reading_list.title: Introduction to Algebraic Number Theory
reading_list.author: Ian Stewart and David Tall
reading_list.description: Comprehensive introduction to algebraic number theory with clear explanations of fundamental concepts

reading_list.title: Formal Methods in Software Engineering
reading_list.author: Michael Jackson
reading_list.description: Essential reading on applying formal methods to software development

reading_list.title: Category Theory for Programmers
reading_list.author: Bartosz Milewski
reading_list.description: Category theory explained for programmers with practical examples

reading_list.title: The Art of Computer Programming
reading_list.author: Donald Knuth
reading_list.description: Classic comprehensive reference on computer programming algorithms

reading_list.title: Type Theory and Formal Proof
reading_list.author: Rob Nederpelt and Herman Geuvers
reading_list.description: Introduction to type theory and its applications in formal verification

reading_list.title: Homotopy Type Theory: Univalent Foundations of Mathematics
reading_list.author: The Univalent Foundations Program
reading_list.description: Foundational work on homotopy type theory and univalent foundations

reading_list.title: Elements of Algebraic Geometry
reading_list.author: Robin Hartshorne
reading_list.description: Classic graduate-level textbook on algebraic geometry

reading_list.title: Programming Language Foundations in Agda
reading_list.author: Philip Wadler and Wen Kokke
reading_list.description: Interactive textbook on programming language theory using Agda

reading_list.title: Software Foundations
reading_list.author: Benjamin Pierce et al.
reading_list.description: Interactive textbook on formal verification using Coq

reading_list.title: Real Analysis: Modern Techniques and Their Applications
reading_list.author: Gerald Folland
reading_list.description: Comprehensive treatment of real analysis with applications
